statement:
Maximum principle

:   Let $f:U\to {\mathbb{R}}$ (where $U\subseteq {\mathbb{R}}^d$) be a
    harmonic function. Then $f$ attains its extremal values on any
    compact $K\subseteq U$ on the boundary $\partial K$ of $K$. If $f$
    attains an extremal value anywhere in the *interior* of $K$, then it
    is constant.

Maximal modulus principle

:   Let $f:U\to{\mathbb{C}}$ (where $U\subseteq {\mathbb{C}}$) be a
    holomorphic function. Then $|f|$ attains its maximal value on any
    compact $K\subseteq U$ on the boundary $\partial K$ of $K$. If $|f|$
    attains its maximal value anywhere on the *interior* of $K$, then it
    is constant.
